intro: Triumfetta mearnsii, commonly known as Mearns' triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Triumfetta mearnsii is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
